page.title: 03DINSDALE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The Parish Church of Dinsdale-St. John's in the diocese of Durham is in plurality with All Saints, Hurworth, and Sockburn Churches since 1962. One service each Sunday is celebrated and other services for special occasions such as Harvest, Carol, Wedding and Funeral Services. The number on the electoral roll in 1985 is 33, and the approximate number attending regular worship is 14. In the church porch the horizontal grave stone of Goseylynus Surtees, early owner of the Manor House, can be seen. The graveyard surrounding the church is still in use and has fine examples of Hog Back Gravestones which are Danish in Origin The Old Rectory is now a private house and the old village hall now forms part of the outbuildings of this house. The Rector lives in Hurworth.
